column1: “Dr. H.H Holmes or Beast of Chicago”
Rebecca Kerns, Tiffany Lewis, Caitlin McClure
Sister, Ellen M. Mudgett, is born (U.S. Census lists Ellen as being 7 in 1860 and 18 in
Brother, Arthur P. Mudgett, is born (U.S. Census lists Arthur as being 3 in 1860 and 13 in
Born as Herman Webster Mudgett in Gilmanton, New Hampshire to Theodate Page Price
and Levi Horton Mudgett. Some sources list his year of birth as 1860 but the New
Hampshire, Birth and Christenings Index, 1714-1904, lists it as 1861 as does Mudgett in
Brother, Henry Levi Mudgett, is born (U.S. Census lists Henry as being 5 in 1870 and 16 in
1867 6 Bullied and tortured by schoolmates. A dead body was thrown on him.
According to the 1870 U.S. Census, Herman is living with his family in Gilmanton, New
1871 10 Sister, Mary A. Mudgett, is born (1880 U.S. Census lists Mary as being 9 in 1880).
1877 16 Graduated high school with honors from Gilmanton Academy
Married Clara A. Lovering (18) in Alton, New Hampshire (Source: New Hampshire,
Completed one year at Dartmouth University before transferring to the University of
Mudgett and wife, Clara, have their first child, Robert Lovering Mudgett, in Loudon, New
Hampshire. This information is also supported by the 1880 U.S. Census listing Loudon as
02/03/1880 18 Mudgett’s city of residence and Robert as being 4 months old at the time of the Census.
Herman, Clara, and Robert are living with Clara’s parents at this time. Herman’s
occupation is listed as “Farm at Home”
Mudgett enrolls in the University of Vermont Medical School before transferring to the
1882 21 University of Michigan after less than a year (Source: University of Vermont Registrar’s
Started medical school at the University of Michigan. Mudgett was briefly expelled from
medical school for stealing corpses but was soon readmitted.
Graduated from the University of Michigan medical school and moved to Minneapolis
where he began work as a pharmacist at a drug store. Mudgett was now using the name of

column3: Harry Howard Holmes.
Holmes moved from Minneapolis to Philadelphia, PA to work at a drug store

Moved to the Chicago suburb of Englewood, Illinois and began working at a drug storeowned by Mrs. E. S. Holton. Holmes convinced Mrs. Holton to give him the drug store inexchange for a promise of marriage. Mrs. Holton and her daughter quickly disappeared andHolmes is suspected of killing them.
First victim, Dr. Robert Leacock, was a former friend from medical school. Killed inChicago by a dose of Laudanum in order to secure $40,000 in insurance money.
Married Myrta B. Belknep (23) under the name of Harry Howard Holmes in Minneapolis,Minnesota.
Filed to divorce Clara in Superior Court of Cook County, Illinois.
Killed Dr. Russell in Chicago, Illinois during an argument about rent for the “The Castle”.Holmes sold Russell’s body for money.
Bought land for “The Castle”, his hotel.
Fifth victim, Rodgers, killed in Morgantown, West Virginia during a fishing trip.
Sixth victim, Charles Cole, killed by blow to head with gas pipe. Holmes sold Cole’s bodyfor money.
Seventh victim, Lizzie, worked at “The Castle” as a waitress and was suffocated in thevault. Was also first person to be killed in “The Castle”.
Eighth victim was Mrs. Sarah Cook and her unborn child was the ninth victim.
Tenth victim was Miss Mary Haracamp. Killed because she witnessed the disposal ofvictims eight and nine.
Mudgett’s brother, Henry Levi Mudgett, marries Minnie B. Shields in Randolph,Massachusetts
Mudgett and Myrta give birth to a daughter, Lucy Theodate Holmes in Englewood, IL.
“The Castle” construction was complete.
Mudgett sold his drug store across the street from “The Castle”.
Ned Conner is hired by Holmes to manage The Castle. Ned, his wife Julia (nee Smythe),and their daughter Pearl move into an apartment in The Castle.
Julia and Holmes are having an affair. Julia refuses to stop the affair and Ned moves outand takes a job with another company.
Julia L. Conner and her daughter Pearl Conner were killed by Holmes. Julia was Holmes’employee (a cashier) with whom he was having an affair.
Emeline Cigrand is recruited by Holmes to work for him at The Castle. They begin anaffair and plan on a December wedding.
Holmes kills Emeline by locking her into his giant safe and letting her suffocate. Holmeseventually sold her skeleton to the LaSalle (or University of Chicago) Medical School.
Holmes kills Emeline Cigrand, Rosinie Van Jassand, Robert, Lattimer, Gertie Smythe (21,Julia Conner’s sister), Kate Gorky, Wes Warner, a local banker, and an unknown person
Poisoned Virginia Anna Betts (WF, 24) in Chicago, IL
Meets Miss Georgiana Yoke in Chicago. Later in 1893 they become engaged.
Female victim #19 killed by use of chloroform.
Holmes poisons Anna (Nannie) and Minnie Williams to death in Chicago, IL
Married Georgiana Yoke in Denver, CO.
Holmes was arrested in St. Louis and ultimately is sentenced to prison for fraud and sellingmortgaged property.
Holmes was released on bail.
Holmes was re-arrested and again sent to prison.
Holmes was again released on bail furnished by Mrs. Yoke.
Victims 20-23 killed.
Benjamin F. Pitezel, Holmes’ boarding house manager, is buried alive in Philadelphia, PA,so that Holmes could collect on Pitezel’s $10,000 insurance policy.
Victim #25, Howard Pitezel, poisoned, chopped, and burned for financial gain.
Victim #26, Alice Pitezel, burned in stove by gas then buried.
Victim #27, Nellie Pitezel, burned in stove by gas, the buried.
Holmes, using the name “Judson”, moves into an apartment on North Winooski Avenue inBurlington, VT (Blow, 2003)
Holmes is arrested in Boston.
Holmes is tried for conspiracy to cheat and defraud the insurance company. Holmes pleadsguilty on the second day of the trial.
Holmes is indicted in Philadelphia for the murder of Benjamin Pitezel.
Holmes pleads not guilty. The court schedules the trial for October 28, 1895.
Holmes’ trial begins for the murder of Benjamin Pitezel.
Jury finds Holmes guilty of murder in the first degree
Holmes submits a motion for a new trial.
Motion for new trial overruled and Holmes is sentenced to be hanged.
Holmes is executed by hanging at the Moyamensing Prison in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
